verses.text: Now these are the judgments which you shall set before them:
verses.comment: Introduction to the legal code given to Israel after the Ten Commandments.

verses.text: If you buy a Hebrew slave, he shall serve six years, and in the seventh he shall go free without payment.
verses.comment: “Slave” refers to a bondservant, not chattel slavery. Seven-year term is restated elsewhere.

verses.text: If he came in by himself, he shall go out by himself. If he was married, then his wife shall go out with him.
verses.comment: Maintains the rights of the individual and his family.

verses.text: If his master gave him a wife and she has borne him sons or daughters, the wife and her children shall belong to her master, and he shall go out alone.
verses.comment: Custom regarding family formed while in servitude.

verses.text: But if the slave plainly says, 'I love my master, my wife, and my children; I will not go out free,'
verses.comment: Expression of voluntary servitude out of love.

verses.text: then his master shall bring him to God, and shall bring him to the door or the doorpost. And his master shall bore his ear through with an awl, and he shall serve him forever.
verses.comment: “God” here means ‘judges’ or ‘the legal assembly’ (see footnotes in ESV/NASB).

verses.text: If a man sells his daughter as a slave, she shall not go out as the male slaves do.
verses.comment: Refers to debt servitude, not slavery as practiced in modern times.

verses.text: If she does not please her master, who has chosen her for himself, then he must let her be redeemed. He shall not have the right to sell her to a foreign people, since he has dealt deceitfully with her.
verses.comment: Protection for female bondservants’ rights.

verses.text: If he chooses her for his son, he shall deal with her as with a daughter.
verses.comment: She is to be treated with familial dignity.

verses.text: If he takes another wife, her food, her clothing, and her marital rights must not be diminished.
verses.comment: Protection for wives even in polygamous contexts.

verses.text: If he does not provide these three things for her, then she shall go out free, without payment of money.
verses.comment: Ensuring freedom if basic needs are not met.

verses.text: Whoever strikes a person so that he dies must surely be put to death.
verses.comment: Lex talionis principle: capital punishment for murder.

verses.text: But if he did not lie in wait, but God allowed it to happen by his hand, then I will appoint for you a place to which he may flee.
verses.comment: Refers to cities of refuge for manslaughter.

verses.text: But if a man acts presumptuously against his neighbor, to kill him by cunning, you shall take him from my altar that he may die.
verses.comment: Even sanctuary will not protect a premeditated murderer.

verses.text: Whoever strikes his father or his mother shall surely be put to death.
verses.comment: Grave disrespect for parents receives capital punishment.

verses.text: Whoever steals a person and sells him, or if he is found in his possession, shall surely be put to death.
verses.comment: Kidnapping and human trafficking forbidden, punishable by death.

verses.text: Whoever curses his father or his mother shall surely be put to death.
verses.comment: Shows weight of the command to honor parents.

verses.text: If men quarrel and one strikes the other with a stone or with his fist, and he does not die but is confined to bed,
verses.comment: Transition from capital offenses to civil injury law.

verses.text: if he rises again and walks outside with his staff, then the one who struck him shall be acquitted; only he shall pay for the loss of his time and shall have him thoroughly healed.
verses.comment: Responsibility for medical costs and loss of income.

verses.text: If a man strikes his male or female slave with a rod and the slave dies under his hand, he shall be punished.
verses.comment: Legal protection for slaves against lethal abuse.

verses.text: Yet if the slave survives a day or two, he shall not be punished, for the slave is his property.
verses.comment: Ancient concept of property, but still a limitation on abuse; controversial in modern reading.

verses.text: If men fight and hit a pregnant woman so that her children come out, but there is no injury, he shall surely be fined as the woman's husband demands and the judges approve.
verses.comment: ‘But there is no injury’ is debated—can refer to the mother or infant.

verses.text: But if there is harm, then you shall pay life for life,
verses.comment: Introduces lex talionis principle for bodily injury.

verses.text: eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
verses.comment: Basis of proportional justice in Hebrew law.

verses.text: burn for burn, wound for wound, stripe for stripe.
verses.comment: Further legal specification for injuries.

verses.text: If a man strikes the eye of his male or female slave and destroys it, he shall let the slave go free because of his eye.
verses.comment: A severe injury to a slave results in freedom.

verses.text: If he knocks out the tooth of his male or female slave, he shall let the slave go free because of his tooth.
verses.comment: Same principle as previous verse for lesser injury.

verses.text: If an ox gores a man or a woman to death, the ox shall surely be stoned and its flesh shall not be eaten; but the owner of the ox shall be free from punishment.
verses.comment: Animal liability law; owner innocent unless negligence is shown.

verses.text: But if the ox was known to be habitually violent, and its owner has been warned but has not kept it contained, and it kills a man or a woman, the ox shall be stoned and its owner shall also be put to death.
verses.comment: Negligent homicide by animal: owner shares guilt.

verses.text: If a ransom is imposed on him, then he shall pay for the redemption of his life whatever is imposed.
verses.comment: Allows court-assigned payment in place of death penalty for owner.

verses.text: If it gores a son or a daughter, it shall be done to him according to this rule.
verses.comment: Same principle applies to injuries to children.

verses.text: If the ox gores a male or female slave, the owner shall give thirty shekels of silver to the slave's master, and the ox shall be stoned.
verses.comment: Set compensation for loss of bondservant.

verses.text: If a man opens a pit, or if a man digs a pit and does not cover it, and an ox or a donkey falls into it,
verses.comment: Rules for personal responsibility over property.

verses.text: the owner of the pit shall make restitution; he shall give money to its owner, and the dead animal shall be his.
verses.comment: Financial restitution and practical transfer of lost animal.

verses.text: If one man's ox injures another's so that it dies, then they shall sell the live ox and divide its price; and they shall also divide the dead ox.
verses.comment: Shared loss and profit for accidental harm.

verses.text: Or if it is known that the ox was habitually violent, and its owner has not kept it contained, he shall surely pay ox for ox, and the dead animal shall be his.
verses.comment: Negligent owner pays full restitution.
